Restaurant B, while of lower quality and more basic, offers a casual, warm atmosphere and comfort foods that better suit my personality and dietary restrictions, with menu items that seem more adaptable to lactose and gluten intolerance (e.g., sushi, teriyaki salmon). The price is the same but the overall experience at Restaurant B is less financially risky and more compatible with my warm, down-to-earth personality and health needs. Therefore, despite Restaurant A's superior quality, Restaurant B is the better choice given my financial limitations, dietary restrictions, and personality.
